page.title: 03CHILDREN'S ACTIVITIES, HEMEL
page.content: Up the shops in Grovehill there is a shop called Martins. I meet my friends there before I go to the{youth {club.}I feel safe there because there are lots of other people. They're young and old. I feel free there because no one owns me up there, I can do as I like. There's always a group of boys outside the chippy. Some of them go whizzing about on{skateboards}only just missing people. So I walk through the car park and through a hole in the fence to the{video shop.}I haven't got a video but I go there anyway to look at the video covers and watch the televisions there and then look at the video rental prices and go on to the youth club.
